author: BNN Correspondents
title: 90 Day Fianc√© Star Angela Deem Unveils Stunning Transformation After Weight Loss Surgery
text:
Angela Deem has shown an impressive transformation ahead of her return to 90 Day Fianc√©: Happily Ever After?. The Georgia reality star was confident about her looks and body when she debuted on reality TV. However, a few years ago, Angela faced a health scare due to her excessive weight gain. In August 2020, Angela underwent weight loss surgery to achieve a new look to better herself. She also opted for a breast reduction alongside other cosmetic procedures to help enhance her looks.
Angela's Cute TikTok Show's Face Transformation
Angela has proudly showed off her new slim face on social media. In February 2024, she took to Instagram and shared a close-up picture of her from a bar. She smiled in the photo and confidently showcased her pearly white teeth and prominent cheekbones. Angela also showcased her jawline, which appeared sharper than her last TV appearance on 90 Day: The Last Resort season 1. Angela joyfully captioned the post with the hashtag, "IAMQUEENOFME," letting her followers know she thinks of herself as a literal queen.
Angela Is A Filtered Queen
Cast members are often discouraged from using filters because of fan backlash. However, Angela doesn't care about critics and loves to use them to make her slim face look even better. In January 2024, the 90 Day Fianc√© franchise star shared a video of her face with minimal makeup on. Angela used a smoothening filter, ensuring she looked her best. Angela also kept her long blonde hair untied, allowing her hairdo to compliment her glowing face and match the vibe of the filter.
Angela Loves Her Coffee
Angela has talked about her diet and supplements over the last few months. Lately, she has taken to her Instagram to promote a coffee supplement that's helped her stay healthy and achieve her new toned look. In January 2024, Angela posted a video of herself sipping on a hot cup of coffee. She wore a cute pink top and big pink earrings; Angela captioned her post, "healthy is what this queen doing 2024," letting fans know that her physical transformation isn't just the result of surgery. Instead, Angela's been putting effort into all aspects of her life.

author: Javier Sheng Pang Blanco
title: El transporte de mercanc√≠as se descuelga del paro del lunes y solo se mantiene para el de viajeros
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos Las Palmas de Gran Canaria Jueves, 24 de octubre 2024, 22:33 Necesitas ser registrado para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir La Confederaci√≥n Espa√±ola de Transporte de Mercanc√≠as (CETM) anunci√≥ a √∫ltima hora de este jueves que hab√≠a llegado a un acuerdo con los sindicatos, con lo que se descuelga del paro del sector del transporte convocado para el pr√≥ximo lunes. Despu√©s de que las ambulancias desconvocaran la semana pasada, solo est√° pendiente de negociaci√≥n el sector del transporte de viajeros, que s√≠ sigue adelante con el paro. Ser√°n por tanto las guaguas, tanto del transporte discrecional como del p√∫blico, las protagonistas de la huelga convocada para el lunes. Son unos 9.000 conductores lo que est√°n llamados a un paro, al que tambi√©n se podr√°n los taxistas. Juan Miguel Su√°rez, secretario de Acci√≥n Sindical de la Federaci√≥n de Servicios a la Ciudadan√≠a (FSC-CCOO), advirti√≥ ayer de que el paro de los viajeros tendr√° gran afectaci√≥n en las islas y ser√°n muchos los usuarios que se ver√°n afectados. Noticia relacionada Ahora el sector est√° pendiente de que se publiquen los servicios m√≠nimos, que podr√≠an salir a lo largo del d√≠a de este viernes. La desconvocatoria del sector del transporte de mercanc√≠as fue recibida con satisfacci√≥n por la distribuci√≥n. Hay que tener en cuenta que el paro se celebra un mes antes del Black Friday. Las empresas ya estaban organizando rutas para lograr el menor impacto. Adem√°s del lunes, hay convocadas movilizaciones para los d√≠as 11, 28 y 29 de noviembre. Si para entonces no se ha llegado a acuerdo el paro ser√° indefinido a partir del 23 de diciembre, en plena temporada navide√±a y con miles de usuarios utilizando el transporte p√∫blico para moverse. La huelga, que era general y ahora se limita al transporte de viajeros, busca adelantar la edad de jubilaci√≥n de los transportistas a los 60 a√±os de edad. El secretario general de la FET, Jos√© √Ångel Hern√°ndez, apunta a que el paro podr√≠a afectar a 6.000 guaguas en servicios b√°sicos como el transporte escolar, el transporte tur√≠stico, o el transporte p√∫blico regular de viajeros que, con la influencia del bono residente canario gratuito, est√° batiendo records de usuarios ya que todo apunta a que este 2024 se podr√°n alcanzar los 200.000 viajeros. En estos momentos se est√° valorando la posibilidad de articular una nueva reuni√≥n que pueda producir avances en el sector del transporte de viajeros. Como adelanto del acuerdo general para el transporte de mercanc√≠as podemos destacar los siguientes aspectos: -Se solicitar√° al Ministerio de Seguridad Social la apertura del procedimiento general para establecer coeficientes reductores en la jubilaci√≥n de los conductores profesionales de veh√≠culos de m√°s de 3,5 toneladas de carga √∫til. En esa solicitud tambi√©n se va a reclamar la compensaci√≥n del incremento en la cotizaci√≥n a la Seguridad Social que deriva de la aplicaci√≥n de esos coeficientes reductores con una disminuci√≥n de la actual cotizaci√≥n por accidentes de trabajo y enfermedades profesionales. -Novedades en materia de prevenci√≥n de riesgos laborales, como la obligatoriedad para las personas trabajadoras de los reconocimientos m√©dicos peri√≥dicos. -Facultad de las empresas para de realizar controles aleatorios a sus conductores de consumo de alcohol y drogas. De hecho, se va a pedir a los Ministerios de Trabajo y de Seguridad Social el establecimiento de un sistema de reducci√≥n de las cotizaciones por contingencias profesionales a las compa√±√≠as que hayan logrado bajar de manera notable la siniestralidad laboral o cuyos conductores no hayan resultado responsables de ning√∫n accidente grave en el √∫ltimo a√±o. Adem√°s del citado anticipo en la jubilaci√≥n, los representantes de los trabajadores tambi√©n defienden la jubilaci√≥n parcial voluntaria por contrato de relevo. Sobre este aspecto, Canarias va en vanguardia a nivel nacional ya que en 2024 se han firmado 3 convenios colectivos provinciales, tanto para transporte de viajeros como de mercanc√≠as, en los cuales se han incorporado todas las facilidades que permite el marco legal para que las personas trabajadoras accedan a la jubilaci√≥n anticipada parcial con el compromiso de contrataci√≥n de un relevista. El art√≠culo 206 de la Ley General de Seguridad Social establece que la edad m√≠nima de acceso a la pensi√≥n de jubilaci√≥n podr√° ser rebajada por real decreto, a propuesta del titular del Ministerio de Inclusi√≥n, Seguridad Social y Migraciones, en aquellos grupos o actividades profesionales cuyos trabajos sean de naturaleza excepcionalmente penosa, t√≥xica, peligrosa o insalubre y acusen elevados √≠ndices de morbilidad o mortalidad. Para ello, los trabajadores han de acreditar un m√≠nimo de actividad establecida en la profesi√≥n. Pero la √∫ltima reforma de las pensiones, que fue acordada por Gobierno, patronal y sindicatos el 31 de julio, trajo novedades en lo que se refiere a la jubilaci√≥n anticipada sin penalizaci√≥n en labores penosas y peligrosas. Estas comenzaron a llevarse a la negociaci√≥n de los convenios colectivos el pasado verano, despu√©s de que patronales, asociaciones de aut√≥nomos y sindicatos fueran legitimados para solicitar que un sector puede gozar de los coeficientes reductores. Los coeficientes reductores han de fijarse reglamentariamente, previa realizaci√≥n de estudios sobre la siniestralidad en el sector y las condiciones extremas de realizaci√≥n de la actividad. En esos informes deber√≠a concluirse que determinada edad puede restar capacidades. Y las citadas f√≥rmulas de rebaja en la edad de retiro solo ser√≠an aplicables cuando no sea posible la modificaci√≥n de las condiciones de trabajo. Los conductores exigen firmar un acuerdo con la patronal que permita al Gobierno activar los coeficientes reductores en el sector, adem√°s de negociar en los convenios colectivos todo lo relacionado con la jubilaci√≥n parcial para la sustituci√≥n de los trabajadores que tengan una determinada edad y con contrataciones alternativas, seg√∫n informa Juan Miguel Su√°rez, secretario de Acci√≥n Sindical de la Federaci√≥n de Servicios a la Ciudadan√≠a (FSC-CCOO). Seg√∫n recalca, esta reivindicaci√≥n no es nueva y se le viene dando ¬´muchas largas¬ª a los trabajadores por lo que no es viable desconvocar la huelga sin ¬´la garant√≠a¬ª de que se vaya a iniciar el procedimiento de los coeficientes reductores, por lo que no se est√° barajando por parte de los sindicatos la posibilidad de emplazar la huelga a una futura fecha para seguir negociando. ¬´Aqu√≠ tiene que haber acuerdo y despu√©s desconvocamos la huelga, enfatiz√≥ Su√°rez. Por parte de la patronal, el Secretario de la Federaci√≥n de Empresarios de Transportes (FET), Jos√© √Ångel Hern√°ndez, expres√≥ que las empresas est√°n ¬´perfectamente de acuerdo¬ª con las reivindicaciones del sector ¬´entendiendo la penosidad y el sobredesgaste¬ª de los trabajadores pero que el problema surge en c√≥mo afrontar ese camino para hacerlo realidad, entendiendo la patronal que es el Gobierno quien deber√≠a asumir ese sobrecoste, no el sector (empresarios y trabajadores). Hern√°ndez tambi√©n habl√≥ del vac√≠o que dejar√≠a este cambio en las plantillas, cre√°ndose un serio problema de relevo generacional. ¬´Ahora mismo ya faltan 500 conductores en Canarias¬ª. El hecho de que en sacarse la licencia de conducir se tarde m√°s de un a√±o y su precio supere los 4.000 euros est√° dificultando ese relevo. Desde el sector de Carretera y Log√≠stica de FSC-CCOO, el acuerdo de ayer en el sector de las mercanc√≠as ¬´supone un paso firme para conseguir una reivindicaci√≥n hist√≥rica del sector, la jubilaci√≥n anticipada mediante coeficientes reductores, que est√° m√°s cerca que nunca¬ª. Ahora se conf√≠a en que se puede llegar a un acuerdo en viajeros para el lunes. Publicidad Publicidad Publicidad Publicidad Comentar es una ventaja exclusiva para registrados ¬øYa eres registrado? Necesitas ser suscriptor para poder votar. Reporta un error en esta noticia

author: Mirage News
title: EU Commission Applauds Provisional Deal on Ship Pollution | Mirage News
text: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on the amendment of Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for pollution offences. The co-legislators agreed to align the Directive with the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships ( [Marpol](https://www.imo.org/en/about/Conventions/Pages/International-Convention-for-the-Prevention-of-Pollution-from-Ships-(MARPOL).aspx#:~:text=The%20International%20Convention%20for%20the,2%20November%201973%20at%20IMO.)) and to extend the scope of the directive to cover more types of polluting substances discharged into the sea, such as sewage and garbage. The new rules will improve transparency by making information available online regarding the pollution offences in European seas and the penalties imposed. Additionally, information on how coastal authorities verified a potential spill after an alert by satellite surveillance will be available online. The amendment clarifies the application of administrative penalties to make them more effective: for example, the size of the illegal discharge, its impact on the environment or the financial capacity of the responsible entity will be considered when the Member States impose penalties. There will be stronger tools and platforms for the exchange of information and experience for Member State authorities. For example, satellite surveillance for ship-source pollution ( [CleanSeaNet](https://www.emsa.europa.eu/csn-menu.html) - EMSA's surveillance and information sharing database) will be improved and will have better resolution. All the new measures make the deterrent effect stronger and contribute to pollution prevention in European seas. Next steps The political agreement reached last night must now be adopted formally. Once this process is completed by the European Parliament and the Council, the new rules will be published in the Official Journal of the European Union and enter into force 20 days later. Member States will have 30 months to transpose the Directive into national law. Background This legislation was presented by the Commission in June 2023 as part of the [maritime safety package](https://transport.ec.europa.eu/news-events/news/maritime-safety-new-proposals-support-clean-and-modern-shipping-2023-06-01_en), a concrete outcome of the Commission's sustainable and smart mobility engagements. The Directive is being revised for the second time. In 2009, it was revised to add criminal penalties, whereas with the current revision has removed criminal provisions and has moved them to the new Environmental Crime Directive, which now covers an offence related to unlawful ship-source pollution and criminal penalties for ship-source pollution. As laid out in the [EU Green Deal](https://commission.europa.eu/strategy-and-policy/priorities-2019-2024/european-green-deal_en), the [Smart and Sustainable Mobility Strategy](https://transport.ec.europa.eu/transport-themes/mobility-strategy_en) and the [Zero Pollution Action Plan](https://environment.ec.europa.eu/strategy/zero-pollution-action-plan_en), the Commission has a vision to set shipping on a path towards zero emissions, pollution and accidents. [here](/eu-commission-applauds-provisional-deal-on-ship-1175659/).

author: Anonym
title: Lille-Sturm Graz (1-1): historic, Losc reaches the quarters of a European Cup - The Limited Times
text:
A historic qualification for Losc!
By securing the draw this Thursday evening against Sturm Graz (1-1) at the Pierre-Mauroy stadium, Lille qualified for the first time in their history for the quarter-finals of a European competition.
Until now, the northern club remained on six eliminations in the round of 16 of European competitions, including five in the UEFA Cup or the Europa League, and one in the Champions League.
Resounding winner of the eighth leg (3-0), Lille only had to validate their qualification at home.
A big victory in
the first leg, a draw in the return and a great first in the history of LOSC: Les Dogues will see the quarter-finals of a European competition üëè
See you tomorrow for the draw üîú#LOSCSTU 1-1 I 90'
‚Äî LOSC (@loscleve) March 14, 2024
‚ÄúIt's a good thing, the objective has been achieved but it's not over, we want to go to the end,‚Äù commented R√©my Cabella on RMC Sport.
The most important thing is to get through it and go as far as possible.
(‚Ä¶) I would have preferred us to win this evening but we are qualified.
We have a very good team but we will take it game by game, I know we have the potential to do something.
We believe in.
¬ª
Despite a scare at the very start of the match with a good chance from the Austrians, Paulo Fonseca's men quickly took the lead in this part.
Yusuf Yazici, served by R√©my Cabella, even thought he opened the score in the 31st minute but was ultimately denied the goal for an offside position.
About ten minutes later, Tiago Santos confirmed Lille's domination with a low strike (43rd).
Three French clubs in quarterfinals, a first since 2004
But Sturm Graz took advantage of a marking error by the Lille defense to quickly get back into the game.
From a corner, Gregory W√ºthrich inherited a ball handed over by Orvat, forgotten at the far post, and allowed his team to equalize.
Without panicking after returning from the locker room, nor creating any new big chances, the Mastiffs patiently and calmly awaited their qualification for the next round.
With the qualification of Paris Saint-Germain in the quarter-finals of the Champions League, that of Olympique de Marseille in the quarter-finals of the Europa League and therefore that of Losc in the quarter-finals of the Europa Conference League, France still has three clubs competing in European competitions.
A first since 2004.

author: Jillian Hood
title: Minister Byrne Announces New Supports for Skilled Trades and Apprenticeships - News Releases
text:
The Honourable Gerry Byrne, Minister of Jobs, Immigration and Growth, today announced two major initiatives to strengthen Newfoundland and Labrador‚Äôs skilled trades workforce: a $3.54 million investment to support women apprentices through social enterprise, and the launch of a new Online Journeyperson and Apprentice Registry to improve labour mobility and credential verification across Canada.
Advancing Women in Skilled Trades Through Social Enterprise
The Department of Jobs, Immigration and Growth is investing $3.54 million under the Research and Innovation program to support the Office to Advance Women Apprentices (OAWA) in launching a transformative initiative: Exploring Social Enterprise as a Pathway Through Apprenticeship.
The three-year project will create an all-female renovation crew operating under a social enterprise, helping women apprentices gain hands-on experience and work toward Red Seal certification. The crew will focus on, but not be limited to, delivering services to vulnerable populations ‚Äì including survivors of domestic violence, seniors and persons with disabilities ‚Äì while fostering leadership and mentorship in the skilled trades.
Key features include:
- Hiring three female journeypersons and 12 apprentices in carpentry, plumbing and electrical trades.
- Providing safety training, mentorship, and customer service supports.
- Partnering with the Newfoundland and Labrador Workforce Innovation Centre to guide project sustainability.
- Exploring revenue streams such as renovations, subscription-based maintenance, branded merchandise and DIY workshops.
The Office to Advance Women‚Äôs Apprentices aims to achieve financial sustainability by the end of the funding period, reinvesting revenue into training and workforce development. Since 2009, the organization has supported over 2,300 tradeswomen and helped more than 230 achieve Red Seal certification.
This investment is supported through the Canada-Newfoundland and Labrador Labour Market Development Agreement.
Online Registry Enhancing Labour Mobility
Minister Byrne also announced the launch of the Newfoundland and Labrador Online Journeyperson and Apprentice Registry, a new digital initiative that will improve labour mobility and streamline credential verification for skilled tradespeople across Canada.
The registry allows employers, apprentices, journeypersons and apprenticeship authorities to quickly confirm certification status online using a simple search requiring the individual‚Äôs first name, last name and certificate or apprenticeship number.
The registry supports national efforts to improve labour mobility by helping people get to work faster. Newfoundland and Labrador joins British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario in offering this public digital service. It‚Äôs part of a broader push to make it easier for tradespeople to move and work across the country.
The registry is publicly accessible at www.tradespersonregistry.gov.nl.ca. Individuals can opt out at any time by emailing app@gov.nl.ca with their name, credential number, birth date and registration or certification date. Requests will be processed within two business days.
Quotes
‚ÄúThese initiatives reflect our commitment to building a skilled, inclusive and mobile workforce in Newfoundland and Labrador. By supporting women in trades through an innovative social enterprise and launching a digital registry that speeds up hiring and credential recognition, we‚Äôre helping more people access opportunity and building a more responsive workforce that can meet demand across the country.‚Äù
Honourable Gerry Byrne
Minister of Jobs, Immigration and Growth
‚ÄúEmpowering women to thrive in skilled trades through social enterprise is about building a stronger, more resilient workforce for our province. By opening new pathways to opportunity, we are helping to meet the growing demand for skilled workers. This is an investment in our people and our economy.‚Äù
Honourable Sherry Gambin-Walsh
Minister Responsible for Women and Gender Equality
‚ÄúThis investment marks a pivotal moment for women in skilled trades across Newfoundland and Labrador. By launching a social enterprise led by tradeswomen, we‚Äôre not only creating meaningful employment opportunities, we‚Äôre building a model of mentorship, leadership and community impact. The Office to Advance Women Apprentices is proud to partner with the Department of Jobs, Immigration and Growth to empower women on their journey to Red Seal certification, while delivering essential services to our communities. This initiative is a bold step toward a more inclusive and resilient skilled trades workforce.‚Äù
Lori LeDrew
Executive Director, Office to Advance Women Apprentices
‚ÄúThe launch of the registry will allow employers to confirm the qualifications of tradespeople and support them in getting on the job site quicker. Moving between jurisdictions can sometimes be challenging, but this registry will remove some of the impediments to tradesperson mobility.‚Äù
Shawn Skinner
Training Director, Carpenters Millwright College
-30-

author: VNExplorer
title: E. coli ‚Äòcaught at Christmas market‚Äô leaves teenage girl fighting for life
text:
Antonia Hay has had surgery and kidney failure since being infected with the deadly bacteria
A girl has been left fighting for her life after she caught a deadly strain of E. coli.
Antonia Hay, 17, is believed to have caught STEC-HUS, caused by E. coli O157, from food at a Christmas market.
The aspiring actress, has spent most of the past two weeks in intensive care, only coming home temporarily on Christmas Day.
She has had multiple operations, including to remove part of her bowel, and a blood transfusion as kidney failure has meant she requires dialysis, and left her feeling her ‚Äúdreams have been ripped away‚Äù from her because she cannot continue her performing arts course.
Jemima Hay, her older sister, said: ‚ÄúShe is lucky to be alive and has continued to show amazing determination and strength throughout this time, despite the immense stress, pain and trauma ‚Äì all combined with an extreme phobia of injections.‚Äù
While the teenager is believed to have contracted E. coli from a Christmas market in November, it is not known what sort of food led to her catching it.
Antonia has had to give up her performing arts course because of the infection
She is one of 30 confirmed cases of E. coli across England and Scotland since late July 2023, with one person having died.
Most cases occurred in December, however, which sparked the Food Standards Agency (FSA) to issue a recall notice for four cheese products on Christmas Day.
The cheeses were Mrs Kirkham‚Äôs Mild and Creamy Lancashire, Mrs Kirkham‚Äôs Tasty Lancashire, Mrs Kirkham‚Äôs Mature Lancashire and Mrs Kirkham‚Äôs Smoked Lancashire, which were part of Christmas hampers.
A further notice was issued on Wednesday by the FSA for the Waitrose artisan No.1 Kirkham‚Äôs Lancashire product, all of which are made by the same company.
Cheese may have been in hampers Mrs Kirkham‚Äôs, an award-winning cheesemaker from Lancashire, makes its product in Goosnargh and is the only place in the world to still make raw milk Lancashire cheese.
‚ÄúThe cheeses are sometimes sold as a full block or served as individual portions and may have been provided as part of a hamper you‚Äôve purchased or been gifted,‚Äù the FSA said.
‚ÄúIn some cases it‚Äôs been sold as part of a charcutier grazing platter. It may not always be clear whether you have purchased an affected product.‚Äù
Although E. coli is often transmitted via contaminated food, the UK Health Security Agency says it ‚Äúcan also be spread by close contact with an infected person, as well as direct contact with an infected animal‚Äù.
Steve Hay, Antonia‚Äôs father, believes it was caught from food at a local market in Great Missenden, Bucks.
‚ÄúTo anyone who may have experienced food poisoning symptoms at any restaurant, establishment or any market stall in Great Missenden during the Christmas Market, particularly on or from 25 November, please can you PM me,‚Äù he wrote on Facebook.
‚ÄúMy middle daughter is fighting for her life after a serious bacterial infection suspected from eating something around this time and we have strong theories, but just need to know if anyone else was affected with any level of stomach issues or illness.‚Äù
%n
Discover Telegraph Wine Cellar‚Äôs new wine club. Enjoy expertly chosen bottles at exclusive member prices. Plus, free delivery on every order.

author: VNExplorer
title: El papa Francisco ya piensa en su muerte: acelerar reformas, cancelar viajes y un funeral simplificado
text:
El papa Francisco ya piensa en su muerte: acelerar reformas, cancelar viajes y un funeral simplificado
El pasado domingo, el papa Francisco cumpl√≠a 87 a√±os y se convert√≠a en uno de los pont√≠fices m√°s ancianos de la historia, apenas superado por Le√≥n XIII, quien gobern√≥ la Iglesia cat√≥lica hasta los 93 a√±os. Un Papa que afronta en esta Navidad una dura prueba f√≠sica para su maltrecha salud, que este mes de diciembre lo oblig√≥ a cancelar el viaje a la COP28 de Dubai, y que lo tuvo dos semanas pr√°cticamente sin hablar, y sin presencia p√∫blica.
¬øSer√É¬°n estas las √É¬∫ltimas Navidades de Bergoglio al frente de Roma? Todo puede suceder, especialmente despu√É¬©s de un 2023 en el que Francisco pas√É¬≥ tres veces por el Policl√É¬≠nico Gemelli, siendo intervenido de una infecci√É¬≥n intestinal, a la que sigui√É¬≥, ahora, una fuerte inflamaci√É¬≥n pulmonar. A ello se suman sus problemas de movilidad, que en los √É¬∫ltimos meses mejoraron hasta el punto de que asegura que presidir√É¬° todos los ritos de la Navidad vaticana. Dos semanas de duro trabajo para un anciano
Lo que s√≠ parece claro es que el Papa ya piensa en su muerte. Es m√°s, la est√° preparando, seg√∫n lo confes√≥ √©l mismo en una reciente entrevista con la vaticanista mexicana Valentina Alazraki. Ah√≠ dio algunos detalles, como que ya est√° ‚Äúpreparando los ritos de exequias del Papa, para simplificarlos bastante‚Äù. ‚ÄúEl nuevo ritual lo estreno yo‚Äù, brome√≥ Francisco, quien confes√≥ que, en contra de lo habitual, no ser√° enterrado en las grutas vaticanas. ‚ÄúComo siempre le promet√≠ a la Virgen, ya est√° preparado el lugar: quiero ser enterrado en Santa Mar√≠a Mayor, es mi gran devoci√≥n (‚Ä¶). Hay una ligaz√≥n muy grande‚Äù. La Salus Populi Romana, como se conoce a la patrona de la citt√†, es lugar habitual de peregrinaci√≥n de Francisco, adonde acude antes y despu√©s de cada viaje.
Unos viajes que, evidentemente, se ver√°n trastocados a partir de ahora. Por ahora, para 2024 s√≥lo est√° confirmado una visita, a B√©lgica, para conmemorar los 600 a√±os de la Universidad cat√≥lica de Lovaina. Quedan en el aire dos traslados transoce√°nicos, muy deseados por el Papa: Polinesia y, por supuesto, un viaje a la Argentina de Milei. Ambos, ahora mismo, en el aire. ‚ÄúVeremos c√≥mo se da la cosa‚Äù.
‚ÄúRecen por mi salud, la vejez no viene sola, la vejez no se maquilla, se presenta como es‚Äù, pidi√≥ Francisco, quien no se plantea dimitir, como hiciera su antecesor, Benedicto XVI, de cuya muerte se cumple, este Fin de A√±o, un a√±o. ‚ÄúHay que saber aceptar los dones de la vejez, aceptar que uno puede hacer mucho bien desde otra perspectiva‚Äù, admit√≠a el Papa, quien no obstante aseguraba que se encontraba ‚Äúbastante bien‚Äù despu√©s del √∫ltimo susto.
Sea como fuere, lo cierto es que, a lo largo de 2023, y tras la muerte de Ratzinger, Francisco decidi√≥ pisar el acelerador de las reformas, como demuestra la reciente declaraci√≥n vaticana que, por primera vez en la historia, permite la bendici√≥n de parejas ‚Äòen situaci√≥n irregular‚Äô y uniones homosexuales y que ya fue calificada como una ‚Äúaberraci√≥n‚Äù por parte de los sectores m√°s reaccionarios de la Iglesia cat√≥lica.
La segunda parte del S√≠nodo de la Sinodalidad, en el que se habr√° de tomar una decisi√≥n sobre las mujeres di√°conos, la moral sexual o el papel de laicos y mujeres en la Iglesia, se antojan fundamentales para entender un pontificado que tiene la mirada puesta en el Gran Jubileo de 2025, en el que se conmemoran los 1.700 a√±os del primer Concilio de la historia, el de Nicea, que marc√≥ las l√≠neas base del catolicismo tras su uni√≥n con el Imperio Romano y fij√≥ tanto los evangelios como el Credo.
2025, aseguran quienes conocen al Papa, est√° marcado en rojo en su calendario, con un objetivo claro: terminar con la divisi√≥n entre cat√≥licos y ortodoxos (separados desde hace mil a√±os) y poner las bases de la Iglesia del futuro, como las marc√≥ este lunes en el tradicional discurso navide√±o a la Curia: ‚ÄúSesenta a√±os despu√©s del Concilio, seguimos debatiendo sobre la divisi√≥n entre progresistas y conservadores, mientras que la diferencia central est√° entre enamorados y acostumbrados. Esta es la diferencia. Y solo caminan los que aman‚Äù.
Toda la informaci√≥n en www.religiondigital.org

author: schneps-rest-agent
title: City Hall turmoil: Speaker Adams accuses Mayor Adams of ‚Äòattacks against the rule of law‚Äô and the City Council
text:
Tensions at City Hall appear to be reaching a boiling point.
City Council Speaker Adrienne Adams on Thursday slammed Mayor Eric Adams for recent moves that she characterized as undermining the city‚Äôs legislature ‚Äî namely not enacting the laws it passed while seemingly moving to consolidate power under the executive branch.
‚ÄúOver the past few months, we‚Äôve seen attacks against the rule of law with unprecedented disregard for laws passed by the independent legislative branch,‚Äù the speaker said during a Thursday news conference.
The speaker took umbrage with the mayor‚Äôs recent executive order blocking parts of a City Council law banning the use of solitary confinement in city jails, which the council passed into law via an override of the mayor‚Äôs veto earlier this year. She characterized the state of emergency the mayor declared in order to issue the executive order as an ‚Äúabuse of power.‚Äù
Mayor Adams, for his part, insists the city already halted the use of solitary confinement before the law was passed. He has also claimed that his executive order is a targeted approach to mitigate safety concerns for inmates and Corrections officers in city jails until his administration figures out how to implement the bill.
Furthermore, Speaker Adams blasted the mayor‚Äôs Charter Revision Commission for advancing certain proposals to go before voters on the Nov. 5 general election ballot that would give City Hall a larger hand in the legislative process. The commission‚Äôs proposals summarily also blocked a City Council bill for a ballot referendum that would have expanded its approval power over mayoral appointments.
The speaker railed against two specific proposals from the commission that, if approved, would give the mayor more power in shaping council legislation. One measure would allow the mayor‚Äôs budget office to assess the fiscal impact of council bills before they are passed, while requiring a second such assessment earlier in the legislative process; while the other would mandate the council give City Hall advanced notice when it intends to vote on public safety related bills.
The public safety proposal would also give the mayor‚Äôs office, or the agency being affected, the power to hold public hearings on the measure.
Speaker Adams said those changes would give the mayor ‚Äúunprecedented control‚Äù over the process of crafting and passing laws.
‚ÄúCentralizing more power within the executive branch by giving it control over the independent legislative branch‚Äôs process sets a dangerous precedent,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt would leave the government less responsive to New Yorkers and have long-term implications for the functioning of our city that go beyond this current administration or council.‚Äù
The commission presented the proposals as designed to make the lawmaking process more transparent and accountable to the public, but Speaker Adams said the body already has a ‚Äúrobust‚Äù and ‚Äúopen‚Äù procedure for passing legislation.
On top of that, she blasted the charter commission as ‚Äúrushed,‚Äù as it drafted its ballot questions in under two months and approved them just two days after its final hearing in late July.
‚ÄúIt is ironic and an immense hypocrisy that the Commission inaccurately claimed deficiencies in the legislative process to justify its actions when it actually failed to come anywhere close to meeting the baseline expectations of the council‚Äôs process,‚Äù she said.
The speaker said her office is weighing whether to bring a legal challenge against the mayor‚Äôs executive order blocking the solitary bill. She added that while the council will have a ‚Äúvery vocal‚Äù response to the Charter Revision Commission‚Äôs proposals ahead of the November election, although it is not yet clear what form that will take.
Spokespeople for the mayor did not return a request for comment by publication time.
